name: Cosmo's Cosmic Adventure
description: What's green with red spots, has suction hands, and has an overbite like Bart Simpson? Of course, the answer is Cosmo! Cosmo is a young alien on his way to visit Disney World with his parents. That is, until their ship is struck by a blazing comet, forcing them to land on an uncharted planet.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 or Windows 8 Processor: Intel Core Duo 2 Memory: 2 GB RAM

reviews.review_text: Still the best game ever.  INSANE! GNARLY! OUTRAGEOUS!
Interesting, yet choppy platformer. I have no nostalgia for it but it seems pretty decent, all things considered.  On the other hand, I do not really like most platform games, classic or not.

This is one of the most Bright, Cute & Colorful Toned MS-DOS that Apogee Software has made in 1992 which is aimed at Young Audiences. I played the Shareware Version when I was a child and it was very enjoyable to play the First Episode, as for the Registered Version, it's still fun to play but challenging when you reach Episodes 2-3.  As for the Storyline, it's really Simple for Kids & Adults for all ages: Tomorrow is Cosmo's birthday and the one thing he wants for his birthday is to go to Disneyworld on Earth. However, Cosmo's Parents didn't notice a comet crash into their ship forcing them to take an emergency landing on an uncharted world. While Cosmo's dad begins the repairs, Cosmo goes off to explore and play but returns to find that his parents are missing. It's up to Cosmo to rescue his parents from who or whatever it is that kidnapped them.
